credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
title: Triumphal Arch on an Ideal Piazza
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and blue, green and yellow watercolor on cardboard
description: View of a triumphal arch placed on a piazza.  At the foreground stands a triumphal arch with one archway, four columns with Corinthian capitals, two reliefs, and two medallions.  It stands on a marble pavement.  In the middle distance, inscribed by the opening of the triumphal arch stands an obelisk.  Behind the arch and on either side of the obelisk are low, one story buildings with large arched niches and small round niches.  In the facades facing the front, the niches are occupied by figurative statues.
name: Drawing
